item.question:

Answer: _________________

item.question: What file is used to display messages at the login prompt when users log in remotely using <font face="monospace">telnet</font>?

item.question: Which of the following commands can be used to determine the MAC address of a network card installed in your laptop?
item.hint: Two of the commands are non-existing. The others both provide MAC address information. However, only one of them will show you which MAC address is associated with a specific network card.

item.question: Considering below choices. What key combination can be used to force restarting the X server?
item.hint: Most Linux distributions running HAL have not enabled a key combination to restart the X server. Therefore, the correct answer may not even work on your system. However, in the past, all X servers would respond in the same manner to the key combination (<font face="monospace">xorg.conf</font> option <font face="monospace">DontZap</font>). The question is about those X servers and the key combination that would make them restart.

item.question:
Consider the following exhibit.
What best describes the above output?
item.choice: The program <font face="monospace">xeyes</font> failed to execute.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: What is the purpose of the <font face="monospace">export</font> command?
item.choice: To save the history file to a compatible format to be used by other shells.
To run a command in the current shell instead of a child-shell.
To setup environment variables for applications started in the shell.
item.correct_answer: To setup environment variables for applications started in the shell.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Which configuration file should be modified to change the action for the <font face="monospace">ctrl-alt-delete</font> key combination?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: What best describes above statement?
item.choice: It will give an error as you can only select from one table at a time.

SELECT will delete all rows in the tables books and authors where
the id column in books matches the book_id column.
It will return only the columns <font face="monospace">title</font> and <font face="monospace">name</font> in the result.

It will select usage of the title and name on tables books and authors if and
only if the id equals book_id.
item.correct_answer: It will return only the columns <font face="monospace">title</font> and <font face="monospace">name</font> in the result.

item.question: Which of the following services are usually NOT protected via TCP wrappers?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Which of the following tools allows you to protect the system from normal users creating a denial of service using a so-called fork bomb?
item.hint: A fork bomb is a simple program that creates many processes continuously. To protect a system against a fork bomb you will need to limit the amount of processes a single user may run simultaneously.

item.question: Which of the following tools is best to copy a file over a network in a secure manner?

item.question: The __________ command prints a list of email that is currently in the queue waiting for delivery.

item.question: A user calls claiming that the internet is broken. What would you do first?
item.choice: Get your towel and don't panic.
Ask the user if he/she has tried turning the machine off and on again.
Logon to the user's machine to verify the claim.
Start explaining what the internet is, who invented it, and why it was invented.
item.correct_answer: Logon to the user's machine to verify the claim.
item.hint: Although many sysadmins would love to tell a user to simply turn the machine off and on again this is not considered a professional response. For more information see System Administrators' Code of Ethics. Explaining the user what the internet is might be very interesting for you and the user. However, this will not fix his/her problem.

item.question: When using the command <font face="monospace">useradd</font> which option can be used to specify the user's home directory?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Which of the following tools would you use to check if a remote system is correctly connected to a network on the network layer?
item.hint: DNS is at the application layer and not the network layer. A protocol that is at the network layer is the Internet Protocol (IP).

item.question: Which of the following statements best describes the output in above exhibit.
item.choice: All sources will be inquired once every 64 seconds.
The system will synchronize with <font face="monospace">ams1.x31.com</font> or <font face="monospace">243-51-223.ftth</font> or <font face="monospace">ntp0.mediamatic</font>.
The system clock is running slow.
The system will synchronize with <font face="monospace">sip.dicode.nl</font> or <font face="monospace">europium.canoni</font>.
item.correct_answer: All sources will be inquired once every 64 seconds.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question:
You need to change a user's loginname from sara to sarah. Which of the following commands
would move her homedirectory to /home/sarah?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question:
You have just added the following line to your syslog.conf file:
But, kernel messages are not being sent to the file /var/log/kernel.info.
What is most likely the problem?
item.choice: You made a syntax error in the file <font face="monospace">syslog.conf</font>
You should have changed the file <font face="monospace">rsyslog.conf</font>
You forgot to restart the syslog daemon
You made a mistake. The facility <font face="monospace">kern</font> should be <font face="monospace">kernel</font>.
item.correct_answer: You forgot to restart the syslog daemon
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: A user calls and complains that he/she cannot work with the text-editor that is started when he/she wants to write an email using a text-oriented mailprogram like <font face="monospace">mutt</font> or <font face="monospace">pine</font>. Which file is best to edit to define a different default text-editor?
item.hint: The skel directory is only effective for new users. The question is about changing the pager for an existing user and only a single user. Therefore, it boils down to knowing the difference between <font face="monospace">.bashrc</font> and <font face="monospace">.bash_profile</font>.

item.question: Users complain they cannot login to a server. However, you have no problem remote logging in as root. What best explains this situation?
item.choice: The file <font face="monospace">/etc/shadow</font> is not present.
The presence of the file <font face="monospace">/etc/nologin</font>.
The set-uid bit on <font face="monospace">/bin/login</font> is missing.
item.correct_answer: The presence of the file <font face="monospace">/etc/nologin</font>.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Which of the following files are used by a linux system for name to ip-adress translations? (Select TWO answers.)

item.question: A user calls claiming that the network does not work. You remember adding an extra network-card to her machine yesterday and did not test the new setup. You have a feeling that the network cards might be conflicting. Which file would you check?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Which utility can be used to restrict access to services managed by <font face="monospace">inetd</font>?
item.hint: The restriction mentioned in the question is network restriction through the TCP wrapper library. The service <font face="monospace">inetd</font> does not have support for TCP wrapper builtin. To enable access restriction using the TCP wrapper library <font face="monospace">inetd</font> can use a separate program to perform the check on behalf of <font face="monospace">inetd</font>.

item.question: Take a close look at the above exhibit from <font face="monospace">/etc/crontab</font>. Which of the following statements is true?
item.choice: The script file <font face="monospace">/etc/cron.report</font> is run on the 1st, 3rd, 6th, and 9th day in january
The contents of the <font face="monospace">/etc/cron.report</font> directory are run in january, march, june, and september.
The script file <font face="monospace">/etc/cron.report</font> is run in january, march, june, and september on monday.
During some parts of the year <font face="monospace">/etc/cron.special</font> is run one hour after <font face="monospace">/etc/cron.weekly</font>.
item.correct_answer: The contents of the <font face="monospace">/etc/cron.report</font> directory are run in january, march, june, and september.
item.hint: The format for a system crontab entry is: <font face="monospace">minute hour day_of_month month day_of_week user command</font>

item.question: The above exhibit for contains a line from the file <font face="monospace">/etc/passwd</font>. Which of the following statements is true, based on the information in the exhibit?
item.choice: User <font face="monospace">guru1</font> belongs to the group with GID 5102.
The username <font face="monospace">guru1</font> belongs to the group <font face="monospace">GURU 1</font>.
Members of the group with GID 5001 can read directory <font face="monospace">/home/guru1</font>.
The file <font face="monospace">/etc/passwd</font> is corrupt as you may not use space-characters in a passwd-entry.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question:
You have generated a DSA authentication key on host linux1. In order to log into host linux2 with
the new key, what do you need to do?
item.choice: Log into linux2 using the command ssh-key.
Copy the new authentication key into $HOME/.ssh/id_dsa on linux2.
Copy the new authentication key into $HOME/.ssh/authorized_keys on linux2.
Copy the new authentication key into $HOME/.ssh/id_dsa on linux1.
Copy the new authentication key into /etc/ssh/sshd_config on linux2.
item.correct_answer: Copy the new authentication key into $HOME/.ssh/authorized_keys on linux2.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Your senior system administrator asks you to do a routinely security audit on a couple of systems. One of the tasks is to get a list of programs that when executed as a normal user will run with root privileges. Which of the following commands would you use to generate such a list?
item.hint: Apparently you are looking for setuid permissions on files, as all choices are concerned with setuid. The program <font face="monospace">locate</font> will not allow you to filter on permissions. The command <font face="monospace">ls</font> might be an option but the <font face="monospace">grep</font> command will only show you directories. So, you are left with two options. Now all you need to know to answer this question correctly, is that for <font face="monospace">find</font> permissions specified after a <font face="monospace">/</font> are logically ORed.

item.question:
A new department's local area network has to be connected to an existing LAN using a router.
This new department's LAN uses IP addresses from 10.10.1.64/27 and the first two IP
addresses there are reserved for the router and a nameserver. How many IP adresses are left for other hosts?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Based on what the above exhibit shows, which of the following statements is TRUE?
item.choice: The script will run daily to calculate the network routes.
The <font face="monospace">renice</font>-command will renice the previous command <font face="monospace">echo</font>.
The command <font face="monospace">calculateroutes</font> will be executed with the nice value <font face="monospace">19</font>.
The script will print the message “Starting route-calculation on” followed by the current date and time.
item.correct_answer: The command <font face="monospace">calculateroutes</font> will be executed with the nice value <font face="monospace">19</font>.
The script will print the message “Starting route-calculation on” followed by the current date and time.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Your senior system administrator asked you to edit the <font face="monospace">/etc/inetd.conf</font> file in order to disable the time service. After doing so, what would be the next thing to do?
item.choice: Find the PID of <font face="monospace">inetd</font> and send it a <font face="monospace">SIGHUP</font>.
Find the PID of <font face="monospace">inetd</font> and kill it with <font face="monospace">kill -15</font>.
item.correct_answer: Find the PID of <font face="monospace">inetd</font> and send it a <font face="monospace">SIGHUP</font>.

item.question: You are the system administrator for a consulting firm where several people use Linux as their desktop operating system.
